name: Broken Routines IPA Series: Centennial
description: The latest brew in Broken Bow's IPA Series is abundantly dry-hopped to showcase the multi-layered complexities of Centennial hops. Fresh top notes of lemongrass, orange blossom and pine with just enough malt presence to balance the bold flavors and finish with a smooth bitterness.

style.name: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale
style.description: Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma. Alcohol content is medium-high to high and notably evident. name: K Sutra Double IPA
description:
I don’t think I have to explain the meaning of K Sutra, but here goes . . .

K. Sutra is a made up word, combining the three main hops (Kohatu, Summer, and Citra) used in this 2nd Double IPA of our Double IPA series.  What did you think?  K. Sutra also has some supporting hops including Bravo, Columbus, and Topaz.

With a nice, smooth malt backbone, and some mild alcohol warmth, this bold DIPA packs a punch (at practically 10%) and coats your tongue with an intense, yet pleasant bitterness.  K. Sutra has intense tropical, citus, pine, and melon flavors that dance on your tongue.  It makes you wonder what it might be like to drink it in a different position!  Yup, I went there.

name: Pulp Friction Grapefruit IPA
description:
This American IPA is filtered and bittered with high alpha hops from the Pacific Northwest, providing floral and herbal aromas and juicy grapefruit, pine, and orange flavors. It’s hazy orange in color and its bold hop bitterness is supported by a pale malt backbone, giving it a medium body.
Complementing the hop profile, a generous dosing of grapefruit imparts an even more pronounced citrus aroma with a wonderfully crisp and refreshing grapefruit tang. With a smooth, clean finish Pulp Friction is the ultimate feel good hit of the summer.

style.name: English-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: Most traditional interpretations of English-style India pale ales are characterized by medium-high hop bitterness with a medium to medium-high alcohol content. Hops from a variety of origins may be used to contribute to a high hopping rate. Earthy and herbal English-variety hop character is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer, sometimes with subtle and balanced character of sulfur compounds. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a medium to high, flowery hop aroma and may have a medium to strong hop flavor (in addition to the hop bitterness). English-style India pale ales possess medium maltiness and body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional English character.

name: Red IPA
description: Red India Pale Ale, featuring English malts hopped with an abundance of New World hops. Subtle floral notes present in the aroma. Toffee notes emerge first on the palate followed by an earthy and slightly resinous hop bitterness on the finish.

description: A true hop head beer! This hoppy IPA is bittered by generous portions of Equinox and Mosaic hops, finished with Equinox in the kettle and dry-hopped with Mosaic.

description: The first of three in a series of IPA treatments. Auto #1 is a tropically tart Sour IPA we dosed with mango and floral hibiscus.

style.name: American-Style Sour Ale
style.description: American sour ales can be very light to black or take on the color of added fruits or other ingredients. There is no Brettanomyces character in this style of beer. Wood- and barrel-aged sour ales are classified elsewhere. If acidity is present it is usually in the form of lactic, acetic and other organic acids naturally developed with acidified malt in the mash or in fermentation by the use of various microorganisms including certain bacteria and yeasts. Acidic character can be a complex balance of several types of acid and characteristics of age. The evolution of natural acidity develops balanced complexity. Residual flavors that come from liquids previously aged in a barrel such as bourbon or sherry should not be present. Wood vessels may be used during the fermentation and aging process, but wood-derived flavors such as vanillin must not be present. In darker versions, roasted malt, caramel-like and chocolate-like characters should be subtle in both flavor and aroma. American sour may have evident full range of hop aroma and hop bitterness with a full range of body. Estery and fruity-ester characters are evident, sometimes moderate and sometimes intense, yet balanced. Diacetyl and sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) should not be perceived. Chill haze, bacteria and yeast-induced haze are allowable at low to medium levels at any temperature. Fruited American-Style Sour Ales will exhibit fruit flavors in harmonious balance with other characters.

name: Horse Thief IPA
description: It takes some gall to steal a horse, but only a love of hops to drink this beer. We use a complex blend of hops to make this beer perpetually exciting to drink.

bitterness.  We dry hop the beer to add a floral, pine quality to the finished product.

style.name: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale
style.description: Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma. Alcohol content is medium-high to high and notably evident. They range from deep golden to medium copper in color. The style may use any variety of hops. Though the hop character is intense it's balanced with complex alcohol flavors, moderate to high fruity esters and medium to high malt character. Hop character should be fresh and lively and should not be harsh in quality. The use of large amounts of hops may cause a degree of appropriate hop haze. Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have medium-high to full body. Diacetyl should not be perceived. The intention of this style of beer is to exhibit the fresh and bright character of hops. Oxidative character and aged character should not be present.

name: West Coast IPA
description: This pale golden IPA is a tropical citrus, medium-light brew that goes great with barbecue.
foodPairings: Spicy foods, Indian Curry, Barbecue, Cheddar Cheese, Rich Chocolate Cake

name: Juicebox Citrus IPA
description: Pure tropical, fruity pleasure in a glass. Fresh orange zest and heaps of extremely aromatic hops give this beer bright, intense flavours of mango, papaya and bitter orange. A restrained yet present bitterness makes you want that next sip, and the next one, and the one after that. Hoppy, zesty, refreshing.

style.name: Belgian-Style Pale Ale
style.description: Belgian-style pale ales are characterized by low but noticeable hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Light to medium body and low malt aroma are typical. They are light amber to deep amber in color. Noble-type hops are commonly used. Low to medium fruity esters are evident in aroma and flavor. Low levels of phenolic spiciness from yeast byproducts may be perceived. Low caramel or toasted malt flavor is okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

name: Orange County IPA
description: A light bodied IPA that goes down easy. We create a slight sweetness and bitterness by adding Cutie Oranges to the boil. Brewed mainly with Mandarina Bavaria hops from Germany that give off citrus flavors and aromas of tangerine and orange.

Bright tangerine takes the forefront, intermingling with citrus, peach and resin as it dances over the palate. name: Brite Day Double IPA
description: Bright orange body with a frothy white head, the Brite Day DIPA exudes aromas of ripe melon, orange zest, and peach. The flavors of the beer match the aroma with hints of green melon, stone fruit, and peach. Featuring El Dorado, Amarillo, equinox, and mosaic hops, Brite Day is slightly bitter, but light on the palate with a hop spice and dry finish.

name: Chieftain IPA
description:
FLAVOUR PROFILE

Appearance: Cloudy Haze, Unfiltered
Aroma: Big Citrus Aroma
Taste: Medium body with a light bitterness level
Mouth feel: Medium bitterness at the front, evenly balanced by the rich sweetness from the malt
Finish: Hoppy, with a light mouth feel

style.name: English-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: Most traditional interpretations of English-style India pale ales are characterized by medium-high hop bitterness with a medium to medium-high alcohol content. Hops from a variety of origins may be used to contribute to a high hopping rate. Earthy and herbal English-variety hop character is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer, sometimes with subtle and balanced character of sulfur compounds. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a medium to high, flowery hop aroma and may have a medium to strong hop flavor (in addition to the hop bitterness). English-style India pale ales possess medium maltiness and body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional English character.

name: San Diego IPA
description: he uncomplicated malt bill – including Vienna and Flaked Rye – allows the large late and dry-hop additions to dominate the nose and palate. Smooth Columbus bitterness is followed by the tropical, resinous flavor of Simcoe hops. Dry-hopped with 4-5 hop varieties lends flavors and aromas of peach and passion fruit. San Diego IPA® finishes dry and clean with a hint of rye spiciness.

style.name: Session India Pale Ale
style.description: Session India Pale Ales are gold to copper. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures and hop haze is allowable at any temperature. Fruity-ester aroma is light to moderate. Hop aroma is medium to high with qualities from a wide variety of hops from all over the world. Low to medium maltiness is present. Hop flavor is strong, characterized by flavors from a wide variety of hops. Hop bitterness is medium to high. Fruity-ester flavors are low to moderate. Diacetyl is absent or at very low levels. Body is low to medium.

style.name: English-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: Most traditional interpretations of English-style India pale ales are characterized by medium-high hop bitterness with a medium to medium-high alcohol content. Hops from a variety of origins may be used to contribute to a high hopping rate. Earthy and herbal English-variety hop character is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer, sometimes with subtle and balanced character of sulfur compounds. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a medium to high, flowery hop aroma and may have a medium to strong hop flavor (in addition to the hop bitterness). English-style India pale ales possess medium maltiness and body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional English character.

name: Double IPA
description: Big malt flavor with loads of hops.

style.name: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale
style.description: Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma. Alcohol content is medium-high to high and notably evident. They range from deep golden to medium copper in color. The style may use any variety of hops. Though the hop character is intense it's balanced with complex alcohol flavors, moderate to high fruity esters and medium to high malt character. Hop character should be fresh and lively and should not be harsh in quality. The use of large amounts of hops may cause a degree of appropriate hop haze. Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have medium-high to full body. Diacetyl should not be perceived. The intention of this style of beer is to exhibit the fresh and bright character of hops. Oxidative character and aged character should not be present.

name: Double IPA
description: We use generous late-addition hops along with a carefully crafted malt bill to create this Double IPA that is nicely balanced. Expect big notes of Citrus, Mango, Peach, and Grapefruit; all these flavors and aromas come from the hops. This beer is unfiltered, so it will be a little cloudy at first. It should clear up with time.

name: Face Melter Hibiscus IPA
description: Three kinds of flavorful hops and hibiscus flowers give this IPA a citrusy intensity. Bold with a pleasantly bitter finish.

name: Machine Session IPA
description: Beach Haus® Machine – This Session IPA burns bright with juicy, citrusy hop flavor and can be consumed with mechanical consistency due to its lower alcohol presence.

style.name: Session India Pale Ale
style.description: Session India Pale Ales are gold to copper. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures and hop haze is allowable at any temperature. Fruity-ester aroma is light to moderate. Hop aroma is medium to high with qualities from a wide variety of hops from all over the world. Low to medium maltiness is present. Hop flavor is strong, characterized by flavors from a wide variety of hops. Hop bitterness is medium to high. Fruity-ester flavors are low to moderate. Diacetyl is absent or at very low levels. Body is low to medium.

name: Toast Black IPA
description: Beach Haus® Toast is a unique hybrid style that marries the deep, dark, smoothness of black ales with a contentious bitter bite. Still every bit an IPA, Toast fills the room with aromas of pine, blackcurrant and cedar wood due to an abundant use of Pacific Northwest hops.

name: Hopbahn Double IPA
description: Beach Haus® Hopbahn showcases both strength and complexity. It pours a deep rich mahogany beneath a crown of tight tan bubbles. Using a blend of American and German hops, Hopbahn yields an engaging, fruity, sweet aroma before plunging into an enduring hop bitterness that lingers long after the first sip.

name: Danville IPA
description: This beer has notes of resinous pine and grapefruit from the liberal use of northwest hops, the crisp, clean fermentation lets the hops and malt shine through, this IPA is a classic pairing with blue cheese.

name: Squawker IPA
description: Our newest IPA creation (2016), this taproom only release can be found pouring year round at the brewery. A limited number of kegs from each batch are shipped out to various retailers by request. This beer highlights some of the new "cool kid" hop varietals and challenges the brewers to pack in as much hop profile as possible while retaining that magical and somewhat legendary Black Raven balance.

name: Beaktweaker Citrus IPA
description: The BeakTweaker is Black Raven’s seasonal IPA release. Built on a firm base of barley and rye malts, the BeakTweaker features bold citrus flavors and aromatics. A firm bitterness combines with citrus hop characteristics accented by the addition of black lemon, orange peel and lemon peel.
